intro: Skeptrostachys paranahybae, commonly known as the Paranahyba Skeptrostachys, is a flowering plant native to the Atlantic Forest of Brazil. It is a shrub characterized by its small, clustered flowers and lance-shaped leaves. The plant belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. It typically grows in humid, shaded environments and is adapted to the tropical climate of its native region. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
